text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prime Minister Abdellatif Filali presides over a cabinet meeting to discuss 1997-98 budget.
- Averate unemployment rate was 18.1 percent in Moroccan cities. The most affected are young people aged under 35 years.
- Agriculture Development Company (SODEA) is the largest employer in the countryside with 24,000 workforce.
- Morocco beat Sierra Leone 1-0 in soccer world cup qualifying match.
- Royal Air Maroc resumes services between Marrakesh and Brussels.
- Joint Moroccan-Egyptian cooperation committee puts emphasis on investment and trade.
- Canal Plus Horizons television cuts subscription fee in Morocco.
- Morocco should allocate more resources to social development in the 1997-98 budget being discussed by the government.
